moves.1. e4 e5 2. f4 Nc6 3. Nf3 d6 4. fxe5 dxe: I don't remember why I did this.  I had great position in the center of the board.  Must have been anxious to move into the midgame.
moves.10. Bg5: Should have seen that coming with the previous pawn move.  It wasn't just to protect e4 from my knight.
moves.10... Qd6 11. Nfd2: I don't know why he did that, but it turned out great for him.  That knight is what really began my problems.
moves.11... Ne3: I thought it was a good move...
moves.12... Bxe3: I suppose I could pretend it was an even trade...
moves.13. Nc4: But it wasn't, opened me up to a fork on my queen and the bishop.
moves.14. Nc3: I knew he was going after my queen, she was not properly developed.
moves.14... O-O-O: Should have moved my bishop at this point... dunno where though.  Probably f4.
moves.15. Na4 Qb5: Best move at the time, if I had seen the whole of the game I would have realized that I was not just saving my queen, but threatening an exchange for my bishop.  But I wasn't paying enough attention.
moves.16. b3: Didn't want to lose his knight quite yet.  Good idea.
moves.16... Nd4: Again, should have moved my bishop.  I was thinking that by moving my knight, I would have more room for my queen to flee if need be.
moves.17... Qc6: Attacking c2, and moving a little further from the situation, sounded like the best idea.
moves.18. Nc4: I assume that he moved his knight here to take e5, threatening the queen, or maybe just negating the attack on c2...  either way, I got no options.
Had to choose, Rd was 'defended' by my K, if you will, so I decided to offer that one.
moves.23. Nxd8 Kxd8: The N is dead!  Ha!...  10 moves and 5 points later.
moves.24. Nxa6 g5 25. Rf7: Has he gotten a little greedy, or has he moved into end-game, leaving me in the dust?
moves.25... h5 26. Rxc7 g4:
26. Rxc7 g4 
27. Rh7 Ne2 
28. Rxh5 g3 
29. hxg3 Nxg3  
highly unlikely... ?
if his R doesn't come to h, then mine can, threatening mate
moves.27. Rf1:
ok, so we are in the end-game now... if I had seen that, I wonder if I could have prevented it.
if I don't protect 8 (f8), that is mate. if R stays at e8, then white R at d7 is mate. moving R-h8 saves me, but I have a one move cushion.
moves.27... h4 28. Rff7 Rh8 29. Rfd7+: not unexpected... but now i see the fork on N... !
moves.29... Ke8 30. Rxd4: I see nothing, considering resigning... but may as well keep going, hoping for a mistake
moves.30... g3 31. Rc8+ Kf7 32. Rxh8:
It's too painful to look at every time I log on... I have to resign.  I must remember where I messed up.  
Over and over I thought I had an additional cushion before I had to retreat.  Over and over I was wrong.  I needed to be just a little more cautious in about 4 or 5 moves, and I wouldn't have needed to resign.
